item.description:
Before signing up for this event, please read and understand the entire Write-Up and the Liability Waiver. By signing up for this event you agree to the terms of the waiver.

 

Rating: Moderate

Distance: About 5 Miles

Time Duration: 2 Hours

Orange: Not Required

 

The Sakonnet Greenway Trail is a 10 mile trail and the longest walking trail on Aquidneck Island. Strategically and naturally forged amidst a greenway of more than 1,000 acres of conserved land on the eastern side of Aquidneck Island, the Sakonnet Greenway Trail is the only pedestrian corridor connecting Middletown and Portsmouth and linking recreational areas for golfing, polo, soccer and more. The trail passes through acres and acres of diverse habitats such as agricultural fields and wooded wetlands called home by many endangered and at-risk wildlife species and is designed to minimize negative environmental impacts. Benches, information kiosks and parking make the trail user-friendly.

 

We are doing the northern section to limit it to about five miles so that we'll be able to finish it before dark.


 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

As always bring sufficient water and snacks along for the hike and a good pair of hiking boots.

 

Directions: From East Main Road (Rt 138) in Portsmouth, RI, turn onto Linden Ln. Travel about a quarter of a mile and go past the Leonard Brown House and look for an opening to a gravel/grassy parking lot on the left. There is a small parking lot sign just before it. Park in that lot. The trail starts there.

 

 

Liability Waiver 

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

 

Safety First!

group.name: Rhode Island Hiking Club " Walks and Rambles "

item.name: Sakonnet Greenway Trail (North)
